## Public Member Functions

### clearsSuperRegisters() {#ac8a4a891bdc2466ae10fe03a0a44bb81}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MCInstrAnalysis::clearsSuperRegisters (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcregisterinfo">MCRegisterInfo</a> &amp; MRI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; Inst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Writes) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Returns true if at least one of the register writes performed by.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Inst">implicitly clears the upper portion of all super-registers.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
Example: on X86-64, a write to EAX implicitly clears the upper half of RAX. Also (still on x86) an XMM write perfomed by an AVX 128-bit instruction implicitly clears the upper portion of the correspondent YMM register.

This method also updates an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> which is used as mask of register writes. There is one bit for every explicit/implicit write performed by the instruction. If a write implicitly clears its super-registers, then the corresponding bit is set (vic. the corresponding bit is cleared).

The first bits in the APint are related to explicit writes. The remaining bits are related to implicit writes. The sequence of writes follows the machine operand sequence. For implicit writes, the sequence is defined by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinstrdesc">MCInstrDesc</a>.

The assumption is that the bit-width of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> is correctly set by the caller. The default implementation conservatively assumes that none of the writes clears the upper portion of a super-register.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h/#l00115">115</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h">MCInstrAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcinstranalysis-cpp/#l00020">20</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcinstranalysis-cpp">MCInstrAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isDependencyBreaking() {#a3554ce11dd9d3f2f85163cbb2da04e8c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::MCInstrAnalysis::isDependencyBreaking (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Mask, unsigned CPUID) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Returns true if MI is a dependency breaking instruction for the subtarget associated with CPUID .

The value computed by a dependency breaking instruction is not dependent on the inputs. An example of dependency breaking instruction on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> is <code>XOR eax, eax</code>.

If MI is a dependency breaking instruction for subtarget CPUID, then Mask can be inspected to identify independent operands.

Essentially, each bit of the mask corresponds to an input operand. Explicit operands are laid out first in the mask; implicit operands follow explicit operands. Bits are set for operands that are independent.

Note that the number of bits in Mask may not be equivalent to the sum of explicit and implicit operands in MI. Operands that don&#39;t have a corresponding bit in Mask are assumed &quot;not independente&quot;.

The only exception is for when Mask is all zeroes. That means: explicit input operands of MI are independent.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h/#l00162">162</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h">MCInstrAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isOptimizableRegisterMove() {#a157de3731ec2fb3a23d1f6c6555bd5d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::MCInstrAnalysis::isOptimizableRegisterMove (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; MI, unsigned CPUID) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Returns true if MI is a candidate for move elimination.

Different subtargets may apply different constraints to optimizable register moves. For example, on most <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> subtargets, a candidate for move elimination cannot specify the same register for both source and destination.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h/#l00173">173</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h">MCInstrAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isZeroIdiom() {#a5bc2035f3f19740e42698b628255c0d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::MCInstrAnalysis::isZeroIdiom (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Mask, unsigned CPUID) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Returns true if MI is a dependency breaking zero-idiom for the given subtarget.

Mask is used to identify input operands that have their dependency broken. Each bit of the mask is associated with a specific input operand. Bits associated with explicit input operands are laid out first in the mask; implicit operands come after explicit operands.

Dependencies are broken only for operands that have their corresponding bit set. Operands that have their bit cleared, or that don&#39;t have a corresponding bit in the mask don&#39;t have their dependency broken. Note that Mask may not be big enough to describe all operands. The assumption for operands that don&#39;t have a correspondent bit in the mask is that those are still data dependent.

The only exception to the rule is for when Mask has all zeroes. A zero mask means: dependencies are broken for all explicit register operands.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h/#l00137">137</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h">MCInstrAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>

</MemberDefinition>

### resetState() {#aa12ce423df5b375e9ea22c80325cff99}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual void llvm::MCInstrAnalysis::resetState ()"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h/#l00041">41</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h">MCInstrAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### updateState() {#abaab000b6a9b695218ee21ccc099e8db}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::MCInstrAnalysis::updateState (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; Inst, uint64&#95;t Addr)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Update internal state with <code>Inst</code> at <code>Addr</code>.

For some types of analyses, inspecting a single instruction is not sufficient. Some examples are auipc/jalr pairs on RISC-V or adrp/ldr pairs on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aarch64">AArch64</a>. To support inspecting multiple instructions, targets may keep track of an internal state while analysing instructions. Clients should call updateState for every instruction which allows later calls to one of the analysis functions to take previous instructions into account. Whenever state becomes irrelevant (e.g., when starting to disassemble a new function), clients should call resetState to clear it.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h/#l00053">53</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcinstranalysis-h">MCInstrAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
